intro: Ferreyranthus vaginans, commonly known as the velvetleaf sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly in countries like Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of fleshy, spoon-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, velvety pubescence. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, often blooming in late spring to early summer. Due to its succulent leaves and drought tolerance, it is well adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments.
